page.title: 02The Scaleby Moss Landscape
page.content: This area was described in the Domesday Book as "waste".Although close to the North Pennines,the few hills here are gently sloping and low-lying areas can be marshy.Timber plantations have been established in some wetland areas. Now all the land is enclosed.Many farmers still keep their original enclosure documents,which date back some 200 years. Most of the farms raise cattle on rough pasture.The other main use of land is to grow grass for silage to feed the cattle in winter.
